unnormalised: So, someone asked about the future of AI in India, huh? Well, it's looking pretty bright, bhai! I think AI's gonna change everything, from farming to Bollywood. We’re already seeing startups in Bangalore using AI for things like personalized education - think Byju's but even more tailored to each student. And healthcare, definitely huge potential there. Imagine Dr. Reddy's using AI to develop new drugs faster!

unnormalised: But, you know, there are challenges. Data privacy is a big one. We need strong laws to make sure our Aadhaar data and everything else isn’t misused. Plus, we need more people trained in AI. IIT Delhi and other colleges are offering courses, but we need to scale it up massively. The govt. is pushing "Digital India", so hopefully, that'll give AI the boost it needs.

unnormalised: Overall, I'm optimistic. India has the brainpower and the need. It's all about execution now. Watch out for big things happening in the next 5-10 years, especially with 5G becoming widespread. Maybe by 2030, we'll have AI-powered auto-rickshaws! Imagine that!
